image.altText: Mid shot of a woman and a man addressing the media.

props.synopsis: Against warnings from health, justice and Aboriginal groups, the NT government says it will fulfil its election promise and return the age of criminal responsibility back to 10 this year.

title.children: 'It's going to scar them': NT to become first jurisdiction to lower criminal age of responsibility

image.altText: NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk sitting in chair being interviewed for TV.

props.synopsis: In an interview with Stateline, NT Children's Commissioner Shahleena Musk says the government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10 will only entrench cycles of disadvantage and increase the number of violent adult criminals in the territory's justice system.

title.children: NT children's commissioner says lowering criminal age to 10 will increase violent offending

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly optimistic that cost of living pressures are about to ease, and expect to receive an interest rate cut soon, according to new polling.

title.children: Hope a rate cut could be on the way as Aussies continue to cut down on costs

image.altText: Shane Smithers, in a beanie, paints intricate white lines on a large mural

props.synopsis: Shane's been in dozens of caves. He's never seen dots. So why are they the dominant Aboriginal visual language?

title.children: 'We didn't have dots': How Aboriginal visual language became homogenised

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile floats on a still body of water.

props.synopsis: Fishing guide Sean Fiumara says he was on a boat with clients when a saltwater crocodile launched at him "out of nowhere" and latched onto his leg, "instantly pulling [him] into and under the water".

title.children: 'I could see him latched onto my leg': Fisher narrowly escapes croc attack on boat

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: The reality of the Middle East conflict is that of an ever-widening fight between two terrorist organisations and an increasingly militant state that is ignoring international calls for restraint, including from its most powerful ally.

title.children: Amid the Middle East crisis, Peter Dutton is accusing the PM of something that isn't true

image.altText: A solar system on a rooftop at sunset.

props.synopsis: Solar businesses across the country are owed millions of dollars for work they have done as part of Australia's flagship green power scheme. But it's not customers owing them money. It's the middlemen, sitting at the heart of the financial plumbing behind it.

title.children: Billions are sloshing through the solar industry. It has attracted 'cowboys’ looking to game the system

image.altText: Wind turbines are set to dot the landscape in Victoria's west

props.synopsis: Five months after the federal government committed more than $22 billion over 10 years to boost green hydrogen as an alternative fuel, two major projects have hit the skids.

title.children: Why Australia's energy policy continues to be dominated by politics rather than economics

image.altText: Flames coming out of a village at night.

props.synopsis: The US military says it conducted 15 strikes on Friday against targets linked to Iran-aligned Houthi fighters in Yemen, while an overnight Israeli air strike severed a major highway connecting Lebanon with Syria

title.children: Biden warns Israel against Iran oil strikes, US military says it hit 15 Houthi targets in Yemen

image.altText: Kharg island

props.synopsis: The US government once baulked at bombing Iran's Kharg Island over fears of a "worldwide oil crisis" — now Israel is weighing up an attack on its enemy's "oil lifeline".

title.children: The tiny Iranian island in Israel's sights

image.altText: A gas flare on an oil production platform in the Soroush oil fields is seen alongside an Iranian flag in the Persian Gulf, Iran

props.synopsis: Global oil prices have been falling until increased geopolitical tensions in the Middle East saw jumps this week. So what does that mean for Australia in coming weeks?

title.children: What happened to global oil prices this week? What does it mean for Australia's petrol prices?

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: Federal police have released the images of seven men they say may be able to assist an investigation related to ceasefire rallies in Melbourne last weekend.

title.children: AFP releases images of seven people as Hezbollah flag investigation continues

image.altText: An Ecovacs robot on a kitchen floor, and its owner crouching over it

props.synopsis: The ABC has found critical cybersecurity vulnerabilities in Ecovacs devices.

title.children: Insecure Deebot robot vacuums collect photos and audio to train AI

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Teens already on social media could be exempt from a ban under options being canvassed by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title.children: PM opens the door to softer ban for teens on social media

image.altText: A race horse being ridden by a jockey sprints towards the finish line near a large green sign reading: "Singapore Turf Club."

props.synopsis: Horseracing will end in Singapore when The Turf Club holds its last meet before handing its land back to the government to build apartments to help with housing affordability issues in the city-state, which has one of the most expensive property markets in the world.

title.children: Singapore real estate prices are so shocking, the city-state is bulldozing this racecourse for the land

image.altText: A black and white cow.

props.synopsis: Everything is bigger in Texas, even bird flu amongst cattle. But while there are concerns for Australian dairy farmers they say things are in a state of alert rather than alarm.

title.children: 'Alert but not alarmed': Australian dairy farmers react to fears of deadly strain of bird flu

image.altText: GettyImages-2176722937

props.synopsis: New Zealand shakes up the women's T20 World Cup with victory over India, as Australia prepares for clash with Sri Lanka.

title.children: New Zealand stuns India at the T20 World Cup following run out controversy

image.altText: A girl looking at her phone

props.synopsis: Young people say racist commentary on social media makes them feel unsafe, as a report calls for a systemic overhaul to address the rampant racism experienced by young Territorians.

title.children: Cruel vitriol on Alice Springs social media pages leaves young people feeling frightened and vulnerable

image.altText: Counsel assisting the commissioner, Philip Urquhart

props.synopsis: One of WA's top youth justice bosses tells an inquest into the death of an Indigenous teenager she has been berated and bullied by coroner Phillip Urquart, and wants  him to recuse himself from presiding over the inquest. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: WA youth justice boss makes extraordinary bid to get coroner booted off Cleveland Dodd inquest

image.altText: A stocky man in a white t-shirt walks

props.synopsis: Matej Radelic is given a spent conviction and a fine after being convicted of two counts of aggravated common assault, after cable-tying the hands of three children in Broome.

title.children: Man who cable-tied children's hands in Broome after finding them in his swimming pool found guilty of assault

image.altText: A large four-metre crocodile sits on the sand bank.

props.synopsis: An online influencer has come under fire for boasting about feeding a four-metre crocodile in Far North Queensland just a month after penalties for interfering with the reptiles were drastically increased.

title.children: Influencer under investigation over wild croc feeding video

image.altText: White sandy beach with tropical palms and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Cocos (Keeling) Island residents are told its local co-operative owes millions of dollars to creditors, putting jobs and supplies at risk.

title.children: Residents of this tropical paradise waiting for answers after major employer goes bust

image.altText: A lady smiling for a selfie with a man on a horse behind her waving to the camera

props.synopsis: Being in a relationship doesn't mean you should feel guilty for travelling without your significant other. Here's why it can strengthen your bond.

title.children: 'Couples that do everything together, stay together.' Erin didn't let this stop her from travelling overseas solo

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: A close up of a man's face with cuts and bruises.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Liberal National Party has accepted a $17,500 donation from a party official alleged to have assaulted a young Indigenous woman and her husband.

title.children: LNP accepted $17,500 donation from party official being investigated over alleged assault

image.altText: Jarome Luai of the Panthers is tackled by Melbourne Storm players

props.synopsis: The NRL grand final is on tomorrow, which just happens to be the first day of daylight saving time in some states. Get the timing right so you can be on the couch in time for kick off.

title.children: What time is the 2024 NRL grand final? What about the women's match?

image.altText: aerial photo of island with blue water and clouds at the top

props.synopsis: After years of negotiations, the UK is giving up its sovereignty over a cluster of strategically important Indian Ocean islands. The move has led to criticism from Britain's Conservative opposition and some local Indigenous groups.

title.children: This tiny island chain has been under British control since 1814. That changed this week

props.synopsis: Ahmad Sadeghi made remarks on social media late last month, the day Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike.

title.children: Kylie Moore-Gilbert, detained by Iran for two years, says 'inflammatory' ambassador should be expelled

image.altText: John Pesutto, David Southwick and Georgie Crozier at a press conference

props.synopsis: After a bruising three weeks of evidence in the Federal Court and grumblings of Liberal leadership tensions, should the opposition leader be concerned?

title.children: 'We've got a huge problem': In the third week of the Victorian Liberals defamation trial, more secret recordings take the spotlight

image.altText: Steven Miles is smiling as he steps off a BCC bus.

props.synopsis: Party leaders hoping to win the votes of Queenslanders blitzed the state over the first week of official election campaigning.

title.children: The shopping centre call-out and a bold promise: Queensland's election campaign is one week in

image.altText: A graphic showing more women than men outside toilets.

props.synopsis: Queuing is never a pleasant experience, especially if you're desperate to go — and while new research has revealed it's an issue that disproportionately affects women, experts say that tweaks to building codes could help reduce the problem.

title.children: Toilet lines are longer for women than men, but simple changes could reduce loo queues

image.altText: Harry Grant, with a huge smile, hugs Ryan Papenhuyzen after he scored a try for the Melbourne Storm

props.synopsis: Growing up on the Queensland coast as the youngest of four boys, Harry Grant's parents knew he had enough "mongrel" in him to tackle any challenge on or off the footy field.

title.children: Charting the rise of Harry Grant from surfer kid to NRL grand final captain

image.altText: Abram holding up a glass of wine to toast at a dinner table.

props.synopsis: Abram Goldberg will be joining the centenarian club this weekend, surrounded by 400 friends and family.

title.children: Holocaust survivor Abram Goldberg celebrates his 100th birthday

image.altText: GettyImages-2176686842

props.synopsis: Without Matthew Dellavedova, Melbourne United dominate the Perth Wildcats, who missing stars of their own.

title.children: Melbourne United dominate Wildcats as Perth count the cost of missing stars
